results.definition: have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense
examples: The DMZ begins right over the hill
The second movement begins after the Allegro

results.definition: set in motion, cause to start
examples: begin a new chapter in your life

results.definition: take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
begin an event that is implied and limited by the nature or inherent function of the direct object
have a beginning characterized in some specified way
examples: The novel begins with a murder
My property begins with the three maple trees
Her day begins with a workout
The semester begins with a convocation ceremony

results.definition: Israeli statesman (born in Russia) who (as prime minister of Israel) negotiated a peace treaty with Anwar Sadat (then the president of Egypt) (1913-1992)
achieve or accomplish in the least degree, usually used in the negative
examples: This economic measure doesn't even begin to deal with the problem of inflation
You cannot even begin to understand the problem we had to deal with during the war

results.definition: begin to speak, understand, read, and write a language
be the first item or point, constitute the beginning or start, come first in a series
examples: A terrible murder begins the novel
The convocation ceremony officially begins the semester

results.definition: have a beginning, of a temporal event
examples: The company's Asia tour begins next month
